org.globalplatform.broker

Interface BrokerCallbackRequest

  • All Superinterfaces:
    javacard.framework.Shareable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CDCVMBrokerCallbackRequest

    public interface BrokerCallbackRequest
extends javacard.framework.Shareable
    Interface implemented by a Broker Application allowing other Applications to request an immediate action from the Broker Application.

    It is intended for objects implementing this interface to be accessed through a Global Service belonging to FAMILY_BROKER_SERVICE and registered by a Broker Application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte FAMILY_BROKER_SERVICE
      Indicates the family of the Broker Service Identifier (0x88).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Field Detail

      • FAMILY_BROKER_SERVICE

        static final byte FAMILY_BROKER_SERVICE
        Indicates the family of the Broker Service Identifier (0x88).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • requestCallback

        void requestCallback(short object,
                     short attributes,
                     short request)
        Requests the Broker Application to perform a specific action, which may result in the caller of this method, or possibly multiple Applications, to be notified of some event (i.e. through BrokerListener.onBrokerEvent(short, short, short, short, short, short, short, short, short)).

        Whether an action (and possibly resulting notifications) shall be performed immediately or may be performed later in time depends on the requested action and should be specified for each action.

        If some action requires notifying the caller of this method immediately (i.e. before returning from the call to this method), then the implementation should implement a mechanism to avoid entering infinite processing loops (malicious or not). If such a loop is detected then an exception shall be thrown.

        Parameters:
        object - object (e.g. entity, asset...) to which the request relates
        attributes - additional object attributes which may be used to further identify the object
        request - request specification
        Throws:
        javacard.framework.ISOException - (ISO7816.SW_FUNC_NOT_SUPPORTED) if the request is not supported or unknown to the Broker Application.
        javacard.framework.ISOException - (ISO7816.SW_CONDITIONS_NOT_SATISFIED) if the Broker Application detects a processing loop.
